meanings.definition: A person who belittles or disparages something.
meanings.sent1: The depreciator always finds faults in everything.
meanings.sent2: She is known as a depreciator because she never has anything positive to say.
meanings.sent3: The depreciator joked that even the clouds were not fluffy enough.
meanings.sent4: His role in the group was like a depreciator, always bringing down the mood.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the depreciator, for their words can be like sharp arrows.

meanings.definition: To diminish in value over time.
meanings.sent1: Leaving a car unused can depreciate its value.
meanings.sent2: The house depreciated in value after the economic downturn.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his love for ice cream would never depreciate.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to depreciate the memories of their childhood adventures.
meanings.sent5: The old book's value continued to depreciate as newer editions were released.
